commit.message:
Clarify PileupColumn::add_indels documentation

In particular, explain how to provide a reference sequence file;
`AlignmentFile(..., reference_filename = ...)` is not connected to
this machinery. Addresses #922.
Remove another temporary test file after test case finishes
Remove temporary downloaded test file after test case finishes
Tidy up whitespace [minor]

Implement pileup(contig=None) for unindexed/SAM files (PR #916)

Reorganise pileup() so that it chooses between IteratorColumnRegion/
IteratorColumnAllRefs/IteratorColumnAll primarily by has_coord (i.e.,
whether contig+etc/region was specified) and secondarily by has_index.

Add IteratorColumnAll() which iterates as per HTS_IDX_REST, piling up the
entire file, which works without an index and for SAM files.  Fixes #915.

Unfortunately sam_itr_next() does not work for SAM files (even for
HTS_IDX_REST) prior to HTSlib 1.10. Instead we follow samtools mpileup's
lead and special case this to use sam_read1() at the bottom level
instead of an HTS_IDX_REST iterator. We duplicate __advance_all() and
__advance_nofilter() functions, but __advance_samtools() is itself
complicated enough that we just make it handle both cases instead.
Fix incorrect quoting in VariantFile contig records
Remove duplicate adjust_capq_threshold argument in the docstring

commit.message:
Encode samfile.index_filename before passing it to C function

Fixes #840.
Bump htslib/etc version numbers in README.rst and doc/index.rst

Avoid hts_useek/hts_utell() functions which are hidden in HTSlib 1.10

Starting from HTSlib 1.10, these functions cannot be called from outside
libhts.so. Instead use hseek/htell() directly by dereferencing self.htsfile
to self.htsfile.fp.hfile as appropriate -- but note that this constitutes
illegitimate access to HTSlib's htsFile internals, and should be rewritten
in terms of hts_seek/hts_tell() functions when a future HTSlib release
provides such functions.

Allow VariantFile.fetch() on files with no records (issue #904)

When there are no records, .tbi indexes contain no reference sequences,
which BaseIndex.__bool__() over-cleverly reports as False. In fetch(),
what we're really checking for is that self.index is an Index object,
not that it's an Index object that is True. (This is the only such
instance of `if [not] self.index`.)

Add recently added samtools/bcftools commands; remove import

Remove samimport / `samtools import`, which has been removed from
upstream samtools (samtools/samtools#1185).

Backport samtools fix: Avoid calling fclose() on stdout

Apply PR samtools/samtools#1208. Pysam's samtools.pysam.[ch] stdio
wrapper can deal with stdout's underlying file descriptor being
closed (as happens in bam2fq and reheader) but not with the FILE*
itself being fclose()ed.

Import upstream htslib 1.10.2, samtools 1.10, and bcftools 1.10.2

Prior to importing, change HTS_VERSION to HTS_VERSION_TEXT in
pysam/version.h, as that is the macro name in HTSlib 1.10.2.

Then for each package:

rm -rf htslib;   python3 devtools/import.py htslib   .../htslib-1.10.2
rm -rf samtools; python3 devtools/import.py samtools .../samtools-1.10
rm -rf bcftools; python3 devtools/import.py bcftools .../bcftools-1.10.2

Remove include.samtools.win32 in setup.py, as it no longer exists.

Update devtools/import.py: update versions, suppress bam_tview_main()

Add to SPECIFIC_SUBSTITUTIONS to comment out the bam_tview_main()
call that has previously been commented out by hand on each import.

Read the htslib/samtools/bcftools version number from version.sh
and update pysam/version.py and pysam/version.h accordingly.
(Remove the TODOs from pysam/version.py now that this is automated.)

Remove the previously hand-added individual */version.h files;
instead compiling htslib/samtools/bcftools will use pysam/version.h,
which is already on the include path. (For htslib-1.9, the C version
macro is HTS_VERSION, but in later versions it will have changed to
HTS_VERSION_TEXT.)

Also copy */version.sh into the imported directories. This is strictly
unnecessary but it is useful to have a record of the upstream version
number within each imported directory.

Rerun devtools/import.py to remove */misc,plugins,test} etc

Re-import htslib, bcftools, and samtools with the updated script
to remove unused subdirectories and sundries, notably */test.
(Previously the bulk of */test etc were omitted, but various
items had crept back in as this was not fully automated.)

Preserve the hand-made */version.h files and samtools/bamtk.c.pysam.c
fix and the backported htslib/configure fix.

Update devtools/import.py and don't import */test/* etc

Pysam's build and tests do not use {htslib,samtools,bcftools}/test
so remove them from the repository and do not import them in future.
Similarly samtools/misc and bcftools/plugins are unused, so remove
them from the import list entirely (rather than listing most misc/*
files and having a note to remove plugins/* manually).

Update so that import.py can be used for htslib too: add the build
infrastructure, but don't run _update_pysam_files() for htslib.

Don't list hfile_irods.c, which was moved to its own repository long
ago and removed from HTSlib 1.4.
